intro: Trichosma dilutum, commonly known as the slender liverwort, is a small, non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a thalloid structure with a leafy shoot system and is characterized by its delicate, branching form. It reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia. Trichosma dilutum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
